column1: 54. The owner of a holding or permit-holder may make a further nomination in lieu
of any nomination which has been cancelled, and a person may be renominated as
successor  notwithstanding  the  previous  cancellation  of  the  nomination  of  that
Accordingly, this Court is of the view that the cancellation of the Petitionerâ€™s
first  appointment  as  the  successor  and  reappointment  of  the  Petitioner  as
successor on 02.04.2008 had been affected in terms of the law.
Nomination of the Petitioner, and the 7th Respondent as Co-Successors

It  appears 
from  the  Land  Ledger 
(P6) 
that  the  Petitioner  and  the  7th
Respondent were appointed as successors on 17.12.2008, giving an extent of
one acre of the land to the Petitioner and half an acre of the land to the 7th
Respondent  on  the  request  of  the  permit  holder.  However,  the  Petitioner
challenges such nominations of the Petitioner, and the 7th Respondent as co-
successors on the basis that the renomination of the Petitioner as successor

dated  02.04.2008  had  not  been  duly  cancelled  before 
such  multiple
nominations.  As  per  Section  62(1)  of  the  Land  Development  Ordinance

cancellation  of  nomination 
in  due  manner 
is  a  mandatory 
statutory
requirement before registering a new nomination. Said Section 62(1) reads as
